sen.j: 池田 重利（いけだ しげとし、天正14年（1586年） - 寛永8年1月10日 (旧暦)（1631年2月10日））は江戸時代初期の大名で新宮藩 (播磨国)の初代藩主。
sen.e: Shigetoshi IKEDA (1586 - 1631 February 10) is a Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of an early Edo period, and the first lord of Shingu-han Domain (Harima Province).

sen.e: In the beginning, he served for Kyonyo who founded Higashi Hongan-ji Temple together with his father.

sen.j: だが、教如とは相性が悪く、父親が死んだ慶長14年（1609年）に母方の叔父である池田輝政の元へ出奔してしまった。
sen.e: However, because he did not get along well with Kyonyo, in 1609 when his father passed away, he ran away to the mother-side uncle, Terumasa IKEDA's place.

sen.j: 下間頼広はかつて一向一揆を率いていた本願寺の坊官に相応しく学識だけではなく武芸にも通じていた事から、叔父から仕官を勧められて3,000石をもって輝政の嫡子・池田利隆の補佐を命じられた。
sen.e: Since Raiko SHIMOTSUMA has been taught well of not only the educational learning but of military art just as well aw the bokan of Hongan-ji Temple who lead the Ikko sect's revolt, he was given 3000 koku and to assist Terumasa's legitimate child, Toshitaka IKEDA as an order from this uncle.

Raiko SHIMOTSUMA as Bokan of Hongan-ji Temple, that lead the Ikko sect's riot, was well schooled in both academic subjects as well as the military arts, so he was suggested to serve a master by his uncle and ordered to assist Terumasa's legitimate child, Toshitaka IKEDA, with 3,000 koku.

sen.j: 4年後、利隆が輝政の後を継ぐと池田姓を与えられて「池田重利」と改名し、翌年には池田氏重臣として徳川家康に拝謁している。
sen.e: Four years later, when Toshitaka succeeds after Terumasa, Raiko receives the Ikeda name, and changes his name to 'Shigetoshi IKEDA' and in the following year he was granted an audience by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA as a senior vassal of Ikeda clan.

sen.j: 大坂の陣では尼崎城を守って戦功があり、戦後に家康から1万石を与えられて大名となった。
sen.e: In the Osaka no Jin (the Siege of Osaka), he protected Amagasaki-jo Castle and achieved a distinguished war service, and after the war, he was given ten thousand koku crop fields from Ieyasu and became Daimyo.

sen.e: In 1626 he establishes the jinya (regional government office) in Shingu, Itto District, Harima Prefecture (present Shingu-cho, Tatsuno City, Hyogo Prefecture) and founded the Shingu-han Domain.
